org.eclipse.viatra.dse.api.strategy.impl

Class FixedPriorityStrategy

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.viatra.dse.api.strategy.impl.FixedPriorityStrategy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IStrategy

    public class FixedPriorityStrategy
extends java.lang.Object
implements IStrategy
    Works as DepthFirstStrategy but:
    • works only with single thread,
    • in a given state, it only traverses the activations with locally the highest priority.

      • withRulePriority

        public FixedPriorityStrategy withRulePriority(BatchTransformationRule<?,?> rule,
                                              int priority)
        Assigns a priority to a rule. Unassigned rule will have a priority of 0.
        Parameters:
        rule - The transformation rule.
        priority - The priority of the rule. Higher is better.
        Returns:
        The actual instance to enable a builder pattern like usage.

      • explore

        public void explore()
        Description copied from interface: IStrategy
        This method explores the design space as the implementation specifies. It will be called only once, hence the exploration loop is run by the implementation. The termination condition is also specified by the implementation and when it returns the exploration thread will be disposed.
        Specified by:
        explore in interface IStrategy

      • interruptStrategy

        public void interruptStrategy()
        Description copied from interface: IStrategy
        The implementation of this interface should be ready to be interrupted. If this method is called, the IStrategy.explore() method should return ASAP. This method is also called by the SolutionStore class if enough solutions are found.
        Specified by:
        interruptStrategy in interface IStrategy
